meanings.definition: The space between two intersecting lines or surfaces at or close to the point where they meet.
meanings.sent1: I measured the angle between the two walls in the room.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter cut the wood at a precise angle.
meanings.sent3: The angle of the corner made it tricky to place the furniture.
meanings.sent4: Her sharp wit approached the topic from a different angle.
meanings.sent5: The angle of the sun cast long shadows across the floor.

meanings.definition: A corner, especially an external projection or an internal recess of a structure.
meanings.sent1: The cat curled up in the cozy angle of the armchair.
meanings.sent2: He bumped his head on the sharp angle of the table.
meanings.sent3: The angle of the roof made it look like a hat on the house.
meanings.sent4: She found a hidden nook in the angle of the garden wall.
meanings.sent5: The spider built its web in the dark angle of the room.

meanings.definition: A particular way of approaching or considering an issue or problem.
meanings.sent1: She had a unique angle on how to solve the puzzle.
meanings.sent2: The team discussed the problem from a different angle.
meanings.sent3: His angle on the situation made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Looking at it from that angle, it all made sense.
meanings.sent5: Her fresh angle brought a new perspective to the debate.
